name: snis
description: An SNI object represents a many-to-one mapping of hostnames to a certificate. That is, a certificate object can have many hostnames associated with it; when Kong receives an SSL request, it uses the SNI field in the Client Hello to lookup the certificate object based on the SNI associated with the certificate.

fields.name: name
fields.help: The SNI name to associate with the given certificate.

fields.name: tags
fields.help: An optional set of strings associated with the SNIs, for grouping and filtering.

fields.name: certificate.id
fields.help: The id (a UUID) of the certificate with which to associate the SNI hostname With form-encoded, the notation is certificate.id=<certificate_id>. With JSON, use "certificate":{"id":"<certificate_id>"}.
